law.catch_line: Protection of person dealing with trustee.

text.section: A person that in good faith assists a trustee, or in good faith and for value deals with a trustee, without knowledge that the trustee is exceeding or improperly exercising the trusteeâ€™s power, is protected from liability as if the trustee properly exercised the power.
A person that in good faith deals with a trustee need not inquire into the extent of a trusteeâ€™s power or the propriety of the exercise of the power.
A person that in good faith delivers property to a trustee need not ensure its proper use.

A person that in good faith and without knowledge that the trusteeship has terminated assists a former trustee as if the former trustee were still a trustee, or in good faith and for value deals with a former trustee as if the former trustee were still a trustee, is protected from liability as if the former trustee were still a trustee.

law.history: Created 2012 Ky. Acts ch. 81, sec. 36, effective July 12, 2012.
